column2: vōce meā ad Dominum dēprecātus sum. ^ I cried to the Lord with my voice; with my voice I made supplication to the Lord.

column1: 3 ^ Effundō in conspectū ejus dēprecātiōnem meam
column2: et trībulātiōnem meam ante ipsum prōnūntiō. ^ In his sight I pour out my supplication
column3: and before him I declare my trouble.

column1: 4 ^ In dēficiendō ex mē spīritum meum
column2: et tū cognōvistī sēmitās meās. In viā hāc quā ambulābam abscondērunt laqueum mihi. ^ When my spirit failed me
column3: then thou knewest my paths. In this way wherein I walked
column4: they have hidden a snare for me.

column3: et nōn erat quī cognōsceret mē. Perīvit fuga ā mē
column4: et nōn est quī requīrat animam meam. ^ I looked on my right hand
column6: and there was no one that would know me. Flight hath failed me
column7: and there is no one that hath regard to my soul.

column2: Domine; dīxī: Tū es spēs mea
column3: portiō mea in terrā vīventium. ^ I cried to thee
column4: O Lord; I said: Thou art my hope
column5: my portion in the land of the living.

column2: quia humiliātus sum nimis. Līberā mē ā persequentibus mē
column3: quia confortātī sunt super mē. ^ Attend to my supplication
column4: for I am brought very low. Deliver me from my persecutors
column5: for they are stronger than I.

column1: 8 ^ Ēdūc dē custōdiā animam meam ad confitendum nōminī tuō; mē expectant jūstī dōnec retribuās mihi. ^ Bring my soul out of prison
column2: that I may praise thy name; the just wait for me
